Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the interior is lightly covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, the lower section of which is ribbed, is covered with a buff-coloured slip and traces of two lines of red-painted text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394380) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394380)
